title.narrative: Consolidating UNIDO's positioning in the G20

description.narrative: Following up project 160084 “UNIDO involvement in G20 in 2016 and 2017”, the proposed project aims to advance ISID in the global development agenda by further strengthening the awareness and understanding of the G20 on industrial development issues. With “industrialization” being one of the so-called sustainable development sectors (SDS) of the G20 2030 Agenda Action Plan, UNIDO has an opportunity to build on the “G20 initiative on supporting industrialization in Africa and LDCs” of 2016 and maintain it on the agenda of the Group. The proposed project will have a timeframe of 18 months, covering the 2019 and 2020 Presidencies. The expected outcome of the proposed project is the increased technical, institutional, policy and thematic understanding of ISID issues by G20 members. This in turn is expected to trigger the behavioral change of improving the coordination of global development support for ISID and leveraging partnerships for scaled up impact, in line with UNIDO’s strategic objectives and priorities. UNIDO has been officially requested to participate in the G20 deliberations since 2016, mostly by providing various levels of input to the G20 Development Working Group, under the Sherpa Track. UNIDO has also provided (and has the potential to continue to do so) valuable input to other working groups, including the Digital Economy Task Force or the Environment Working Group. Moreover, UNIDO participates in other work streams around the main G20 framework, including Women 20 (W20) and Think-Tank 20 (T20). To further strengthen UNIDO’s positioning, the project includes activities and outputs to improve the internal coordination of the Organization’s inputs, to better capitalize on the efforts made. As in the precedent project, through its involvement in the G20 and particularly in the Development Working Group (DWG), UNIDO will be able to substantially increase the organization’s visibility and strengthen its ties with major donor countries and other international organizations within the context of the G20 platform. UNIDO’s activities in the context of this project include support to the agenda of the G20 Japan Presidency, not least by providing a progress report on the G20 initiative on supporting Industrialization in Africa and LDCs. At the same time, input will be provided by UNIDO to other deliverables of the DWG, including on i) Quality Infrastructure; ii) Human Capital Investment; iii) Osaka Update; iv) STI for SDGs; and v) Comprehensive Accountability Report (CAR). The project will also include the organization of the 2019 Forum on Globalization and Industrialisation (FGI), to be featured as part of the official programme of T20 Summit under Japan’s presidency of the G20. The event, open to participants at the T20 Summit, aims to bring together 150-200 academics, policymakers, representatives from international organizations and businesses to discuss the challenges and opportunities of GVCs for inclusive and sustainable development. Looking ahead, the project will support UNIDO’s effort to participate in and influence the deliberations of the 2020 Presidency (Saudi Arabia) and the following ones. UNIDO engagement will require staff travel to meetings, including in Japan and New York, in order to facilitate the coordination and delivery of the organization’s contributions to the G20 processes and deliberations.
